TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Adjustable Landing Gear v1.2.0 (mass/cost scaling, tech nodes, drag) - May 30

Articles.Content:
Its it just me ... or does anyone else get this filling of ... where did I go wrong when you see ppl like...BahamutoD, Roverdude, keptin, alexustas, Mihara, kospy44, Quiznos323 and many many more (so many more) make all these epic mods. I mean the make these amazing things and do it for free. I cant even cook without getting overwhelmed ... Oh well at least my cats love me.

Thank you for your Epic work BahamutoD, as always its beautiful.

Oh well at least my cats love me.

Message for you sir!...

"Oh it's not that. We just like the fact you bring delicious treats and clean out the sandbox. Those are the only things that are saving you from a midnight smothering. Now I believe there's a wide scattering of litter in the area of the sandbox. Go fulfill your purpose and leave the warm, soft, low-wheeled-platform and the noisy-tiled bed next to the glowing window for us to occupy.

Sincerely,

The Cats (your somewhat disdainful overlords)"
After getting used to this,I cant stand to stock wheels,they are so simple,like ancient rock wheels..

Update v1.1.0

- KSP 1.0+ Compatibility

- Added large gear set

- Forked FSWheel and related classes (Firespitter no longer required)

- Added brake torque tweakable

- Added part scale tweakable

- Fixed reversed motor issue

- Negative leg angle

- Smoothed steering

- Fixed steering direction based on location on vessel

- Other bugfixes

Known issues

- Lag sometimes when looking at/adjusting tweakscale sliders

- Part cost and mass do not scale with part scale

- Shielding does not actually provide heat shielding (just color)

- I didn't take the gear alignment guide lines from FS so.. no guide lines for now.

Let me know if you find more issues.

Edited May 6, 2015 by BahamutoD

Nice!

I would recommend distributing the next version with DDS textures, which save significant memory and loading time. You don't have many textures here so it's not going to make a world of difference but when you have a large number of mods installed every bit counts!
Phenomenal work! As always! Love the textures. (Also count me in on the DDS texture train!)

Totally luv it

Can you add some more tweakables like just weelsize and smaller suspensions

so that i can build crafts with landing gears like these: (notice the maingear)

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8f/Arado_234B_2.jpg
Whelp, time to fling all the other landing gear into the ocean off the end of the runway
You have no idea how much I wish this was stock...

These are very awesome. Definite must have mod. I just wish we had landing legs like these ;']

Edward

These are very awesome. Definite must have mod. I just wish we had landing legs like these ;']

Edward

I was just thinking that, actually landing legs need to be adjustable in the field for leveling of structures
BahamutoD, can you push an update of the BDAnimationModules assembly to: https://github.com/BahamutoD/BDAnimationModules/releases ? It's what CKAN currently indexes for that dependency, thanks.

So, when I launch with these wheels they fall through the ground and don't animate at all. I've heard that extra FireSpitter.dll files might cause this, and I looked for extras but found none. Has anyone else had this problem/knows how to fix it?

So, when I launch with these wheels they fall through the ground and don't animate at all. I've heard that extra FireSpitter.dll files might cause this, and I looked for extras but found none. Has anyone else had this problem/knows how to fix it?

Firespitter.dll is no longer a dependency, but you need an up-to-date version of BDAnimationModules.dll, which is included in the download.

BahamutoD, can you push an update of the BDAnimationModules assembly to: https://github.com/BahamutoD/BDAnimationModules/releases ? It's what CKAN currently indexes for that dependency, thanks.

Forgot about that, thanks.

Finally Proper scale landing gear for KSP :D

no longer small planes must use landing gear fit for Tu-114/ Boeing 757 :D

nuFAR determines the voxel profile of an aircraft to determine drag. For some reason, adjustable landing gears always show up with a bulky cube, bringing huge amount of drag in nuFAR. Stock gears are fine.

I forgot to mention that in the new version, I made the bounding box get destroyed on start, so see if this gets rid of the bulky cube in nuFAR.

It's back! And better than ever too. Are bogie wheels any easier now? I know the community has spend a long time trying to figure those out, but it seems like vnilla is built to handle it now.

Update v1.1.0

- Negative leg angle

I'd been wishing for this!

Forgot about that, thanks.

Thanks, CKAN should be up to date now.

It's back! And better than ever too. Are bogie wheels any easier now? I know the community has spend a long time trying to figure those out, but it seems like vnilla is built to handle it now.

I'd been wishing for this!

Yes, the new large landing gear are 'bogies'.

The new code actually supports bogies that tilt up like this but I decided not to keep it in because it would mean that the gear couldn't be placed backwards. If you want it like that though, you can go into bdAdjLGLarge.cfg and change 'defaultWheelAlignment = 0' to -30 or something.

Edited May 6, 2015 by BahamutoD

I love the bogies! only the Medium wheels seem to be working. when I adjust the small or the bogies my game becomes VERY choppy and nothing happens with the small or medium wheels.

EDIT: Smalls are fine. Game gets chuggy also when I edit a 2nd set of medium wheels.

Since no more firespitter, I'm assuming that's why I couldn't F2 to see the wheel alignment guides? I really want that as a default behavior for all wheels.
Today I tried a simple plane with these gears, And I wasnt able to pass mach 1. then I used stock gears and easily passed mach 1. is there something wrong?
